contentrichtext.text: '''Charles Gerrit DeWitt''' (1789–1839) was a [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. Congressman]] from [[Kingston, New York|Kingston]], [[New York]]. He was born at the son of a miller, Gerrit DeWitt, and the grandson of [[Charles DeWitt]]. He represented New York's 7th district in the [[Twenty-first United States Congress|21st Congress]] in 1829 and 1830. On March 22, 1831, he was appointed by Secretary of the Treasury [[Samuel D. Ingham]] as one of three Commissioners of Insolvency for the [[Southern District of New York]]. ==External links== * {{congbio|D000284}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-hs}} {{USRepSuccession box | state = New York | district = 7 | years = 1829–1831 | before = [[George O. Belden]] | after = [[John C. Brodhead]] }} {{s-dip}} {{succession box | title = [[United States Ambassador to Guatemala|United States Chargé d'Affaires, Guatemala]] | years = December 17, 1833–January 1, 1839 | before = [[John Williams (Tennessee)|John Williams]] | after = [[Elijah Hise]] }} {{end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=17110348}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = DeWitt, Charles G. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1789 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1839 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dewitt, Charles G.}} [[Category:1789 births]] [[Category:1839 deaths]] [[Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from New York]] [[Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Guatemala]] [[Category:American people of Dutch descent]] [[Category:New York Jacksonians]] [[Category:People from Kingston, New York]] {{NewYork-Representative-stub}}
